alert.note: Alert for Cherokee; York (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 10:28AM EST until January 11 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in South Carolina... Broad River near Blacksburg affecting Cherokee County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Broad River near Blacksburg. * WHEN...Until tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, The Broad River is flooding River and Little Hope Roads near US 29. Farmland flooding is continuing adjacent to the river. The Broad River may be approaching Wolf Den Rd. Floodwaters at this level will be similar to levels that occurred on October 8th, 2005. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:00 AM EST Wednesday the stage was 19.6 feet. - Bankfull stage is 14.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:00 AM EST Wednesday was 21.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage this evening and continue falling to 4.9 feet Monday morning. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 19.8 feet on 05/06/2013. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. For detailed information including observed and forecast stages, flood impacts, flood history, FEMA Flood Hazard Layers, and more, please visit: https://water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=gsp The next statement will be issued this evening at 1030 PM EST.
